meanings.definition: Characterized by mannerisms or distinctive behaviors.
meanings.sent1: Her manneristic way of speaking always made her stand out in a crowd.
meanings.sent2: The actor's manneristic gestures added depth to his performance.
meanings.sent3: His manneristic habit of tapping his foot became a source of amusement among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The artist's manneristic brush strokes created a unique and captivating painting.
meanings.sent5: The cat's manneristic way of grooming itself was both elegant and endearing.

meanings.sent1: The fashion designer's manneristic designs were a hit on the runway.
meanings.sent2: Her manneristic makeup looked stunning under the bright lights.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's manneristic imitation of a famous singer had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The building's manneristic architecture stood out in the modern cityscape.
meanings.sent5: The chef's manneristic plating of the dish made it look like a work of art.

meanings.definition: Relating to the style or characteristics of a particular artist or period.
meanings.sent1: The museum featured a collection of manneristic paintings from the Renaissance era.
meanings.sent2: The writer's manneristic prose reflected the influence of classic literature.
meanings.sent3: The musician's manneristic performance paid homage to the great composers of the past.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's manneristic movements captured the essence of a bygone era.
meanings.sent5: The play's manneristic set design transported the audience to a different time and place.
